content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good for both shortest and fastest mode. Description and test cases are clear. Most importantly, it's fun.
Simple to understand but with a bit of spice with pow and hex, I like it

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is challenging, it introduces hexadecimal to decimal conversion. Can create a variety of solutions.
Cool idea. hope you get approval.
It's clear that reverse is just too tricky for this clash, and I'm not sure why it didn't have shortest. Now it's fastest and shortest!

Nice clash, it's pretty easy to solve once you get the idea. I think it would be fun in Shortest mode.

As for Reverse mode, I think I agree with Nekomancer60 here. I tried it under Reverse conditions and was able to solve it, but I really think that seeing the name of the contribution helped me a lot, and Reverse clashers won't see this in-clash. The only test case that really helped me was the '2048' one where a single character appeared.

If you want this to work for Reverse, I think you need more tests that have a single character, because those are the ones that could really make it clear to the clasher what is happening. But I guess in the 2048 game, you usually start with 2 tiles and it's rare to get down to one...

I'm not sure the best way to go about it, but without some clearer tests, I think this is asking a bit much of clashers in Reverse mode, especially if they've never played the game before.
With only two small cases, I think this might be tough in reverse mode.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Original clash

Hello,

Perhaps we could add a points-only test?
good idea! i wasn't sure exactly what you meant by points-only, so i added a completely empty board and a completely full one. the more testcases, the merrier

You can be slightly more specific yet still keep to using 2 words, e.g.
[Interesting / fun / engaging / brilliant / clever / original / well-written / well-crafted / concise / challenging / tricky] [idea / clash / contribution]
And I'm sure you approve different contributions for different reasons ðŸ˜‰
Yes, you could read it both ways. The more tests, the more laughs. All good for me
